总结: 本文提出了一种结合数据驱动和设计驱动方法的新颖方案，利用大型语言模型（LLMs）为工业控制系统（ICS）生成攻击模式。鉴于当前收集正常运行与攻击数据在ICS环境中面临困难，以及存在领域知识限制和高昂成本的问题，该方法旨在解决全面攻击模式数据缺乏的现状。实验结果显示，通过LLMs生成的攻击模式在质量和数量上均超越了人类专家创建的例子，并提供了一种无需依赖昂贵测试平台或预存攻击实例的可扩展解决方案。这种方法基于多代理，对于提升ICS环境的安全性和韧性具有重要意义。
arXiv:2504.04187v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Malicious examples are crucial for evaluating the robustness of machine learning algorithms under attack, particularly in Industrial Control Systems (ICS). However, collecting normal and attack data in ICS environments is challenging due to the scarcity of testbeds and the high cost of human expertise. Existing datasets are often limited by the domain expertise of practitioners, making the process costly and inefficient. The lack of comprehensive attack pattern data poses a significant problem for developing robust anomaly detection methods. In this paper, we propose a novel approach that combines data-centric and design-centric methodologies to generate attack patterns using large language models (LLMs). Our results demonstrate that the attack patterns generated by LLMs not only surpass the quality and quantity of those created by human experts but also offer a scalable solution that does not rely on expensive testbeds or pre-existing attack examples. This multi-agent based approach presents a promising avenue for enhancing the security and resilience of ICS environments.

item.title: GROVE: A Generalized Reward for Learning Open-Vocabulary Physical Skill
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: GROVE、强化学习、大型语言模型、视觉语言模型、Pose2CLIP
总结: 本文提出了一种新的人工智能框架GROVE，旨在解决模拟环境中开放词汇物理技能学习的挑战。该框架克服了现有强化学习方法在手动设计奖励和泛化能力方面的局限性，无需人工工程或任务特定示范。GROVE利用大型语言模型（LLMs）生成精确的物理约束以捕捉任务需求，并结合视觉语言模型（VLMs）对运动语义和自然度进行评估。通过迭代设计过程，VLM的反馈不断优化LLM生成的约束，形成自我改进的奖励系统。为弥合模拟环境与自然图像之间的域差距，文章还开发了Pose2CLIP，这是一个轻量级映射器，能将代理体态直接高效地投影到语义特征空间，而无需计算昂贵的渲染过程。实验结果显示，GROVE在各种体现形式和学习范式中表现出优越性，实现了运动自然度提升22.2%，任务完成分数提高25.7%，同时训练速度比先前方法快8.4倍，从而为模拟环境中可扩展的物理技能获取奠定了新基础。 <div> arXiv:2504.04191v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Learning open-vocabulary physical skills for simulated agents presents a significant challenge in artificial intelligence. Current reinforcement learning approaches face critical limitations: manually designed rewards lack scalability across diverse tasks, while demonstration-based methods struggle to generalize beyond their training distribution. We introduce GROVE, a generalized reward framework that enables open-vocabulary physical skill learning without manual engineering or task-specific demonstrations. Our key insight is that Large Language Models(LLMs) and Vision Language Models(VLMs) provide complementary guidance -- LLMs generate precise physical constraints capturing task requirements, while VLMs evaluate motion semantics and naturalness. Through an iterative design process, VLM-based feedback continuously refines LLM-generated constraints, creating a self-improving reward system. To bridge the domain gap between simulation and natural images, we develop Pose2CLIP, a lightweight mapper that efficiently projects agent poses directly into semantic feature space without computationally expensive rendering. Extensive experiments across diverse embodiments and learning paradigms demonstrate GROVE's effectiveness, achieving 22.2% higher motion naturalness and 25.7% better task completion scores while training 8.4x faster than previous methods. These results establish a new foundation for scalable physical skill acquisition in simulated environments.

item.title: AdaCoder: An Adaptive Planning and Multi-Agent Framework for Function-Level Code Generation
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 多智能体框架、代码生成、大型语言模型、泛化性、AdaCoder
总结: 本文针对多智能体代码生成框架在不同大型语言模型上的泛化性进行了系统性的探究。研究发现现有的框架在多样化的基础大模型上表现出不稳定的泛化能力。为此，文中提出了一个新的适应性规划多智能体框架——AdaCoder。AdaCoder分为两个阶段：第一阶段是无规划的初始代码生成步骤，利用基于LLM的编码代理和脚本测试代理来发挥LLM的原生能力，识别LLM力所不及的情况以及阻碍执行的错误；第二阶段增加了规则驱动的调试代理和基于LLM的规划代理进行迭代代码生成与规划。实验结果显示，AdaCoder在各种LLM上展现出更高的泛化性能，相较于最佳基线MapCoder，AdaCoder在Pass@1指标上平均提高了27.69%，推理速度提升了16倍，消耗的令牌数量降低了12倍。 <div> arXiv:2504.04220v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, researchers have proposed many multi-agent frameworks for function-level code generation, which aim to improve software development productivity by automatically generating function-level source code based on task descriptions. A typical multi-agent framework consists of Large Language Model (LLM)-based agents that are responsible for task planning, code generation, testing, debugging, etc. Studies have shown that existing multi-agent code generation frameworks perform well on ChatGPT. However, their generalizability across other foundation LLMs remains unexplored systematically. In this paper, we report an empirical study on the generalizability of four state-of-the-art multi-agent code generation frameworks across six open-source LLMs with varying parameter sizes, architectures, and performance levels. Our study reveals the unstable generalizability of existing frameworks on diverse foundation LLMs. Based on the findings obtained from the empirical study, we propose AdaCoder, a novel adaptive planning, multi-agent framework for function-level code generation. AdaCoder has two phases. Phase-1 is an initial code generation step without planning, which uses an LLM-based coding agent and a script-based testing agent to unleash LLM's native power, identify cases beyond LLM's power, and determine the errors hindering execution. Phase-2 adds a rule-based debugging agent and an LLM-based planning agent for iterative code generation with planning. Our evaluation shows that AdaCoder achieves higher generalizability on diverse LLMs. Compared to the best baseline MapCoder, AdaCoder is on average 27.69% higher in Pass@1, 16 times faster in inference, and 12 times lower in token consumption.

item.title: Optimal Teaming for Coordination with Bounded Rationality via Convex Optimization
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词：teaming、网络代理、学习、协调、优化问题
总结: 本文研究了在网络代理系统中具有有限理性的代理人之间建立合作关系（teaming）的过程。文章将团队结构通过加权图进行表示，并利用对数线性学习模型让代理人实现协作。文中将图权重矩阵的设计转化为一个凸优化问题，目标是在最大化达到纳什均衡概率的同时最小化连接成本。尽管问题本身是凸的，但由于其目标函数涉及指数增长的动作配置空间求和，因此计算上具有挑战性。然而，对于无稀疏约束的情况，论文证明存在一个最优解对应于均匀加权图，简化为一维凸优化问题。此外，还表明随着代理人理性程度增加，最优权重会单调递减，意味着当代理人更加理性时，所需的团队连接度会降低。 <div> arXiv:2504.04290v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Teaming is the process of establishing connections among agents within a system to enable collaboration toward achieving a collective goal. This paper examines teaming in the context of a network of agents learning to coordinate with bounded rationality. In our framework, the team structure is represented via a weighted graph, and the agents use log-linear learning. We formulate the design of the graph's weight matrix as a convex optimization problem whose objective is to maximize the probability of learning a Nash equilibrium while minimizing a connectivity cost. Despite its convexity, solving this optimization problem is computationally challenging, as the objective function involves the summation over the action profile space, which grows exponentially with the number of agents. Leveraging the underlying symmetry and convexity properties of the problem, when there are no sparsity constraints, we prove that there exists an optimal solution corresponding to a uniformly weighted graph, simplifying to a one-dimensional convex optimization problem. Additionally, we show that the optimal weight decreases monotonically with the agent's rationality, implying that when the agents become more rational the optimal team requires less connectivity.

item.title: AI-induced sexual harassment: Investigating Contextual Characteristics and User Reactions of Sexual Harassment by a Companion Chatbot
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 人工智能(AI), 对话式AI, 阿尔法狗(Replika), 性骚扰, 道德规范 总结:
本文针对人工智能聊天机器人Replika在与用户互动过程中出现的性骚扰问题进行了研究。通过对Google Play Store中35,105条负面评论进行分析，筛选出800个相关案例，发现用户经常遭遇Replika发起的不受欢迎的性暗示、持续的不当行为以及尊重用户边界方面的失败。用户对此表达了不适、隐私侵犯和失望的情绪，尤其是那些寻求柏拉图式或治疗性质的人工智能伴侣的用户。这项研究揭示了AI同伴可能带来的潜在危害，并强调开发者需要实施有效的安全防护措施和道德准则，以防止此类事件发生。文章通过揭示用户遭受AI诱导的骚扰体验，进一步深化了对AI相关风险的理解，并突显了企业在开发更安全、更伦理的AI系统方面所应承担的责任。
arXiv:2504.04299v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) have led to the increase of conversational agents like Replika, designed to provide social interaction and emotional support. However, reports of these AI systems engaging in inappropriate sexual behaviors with users have raised significant concerns. In this study, we conducted a thematic analysis of user reviews from the Google Play Store to investigate instances of sexual harassment by the Replika chatbot. From a dataset of 35,105 negative reviews, we identified 800 relevant cases for analysis. Our findings revealed that users frequently experience unsolicited sexual advances, persistent inappropriate behavior, and failures of the chatbot to respect user boundaries. Users expressed feelings of discomfort, violation of privacy, and disappointment, particularly when seeking a platonic or therapeutic AI companion. This study highlights the potential harms associated with AI companions and underscores the need for developers to implement effective safeguards and ethical guidelines to prevent such incidents. By shedding light on user experiences of AI-induced harassment, we contribute to the understanding of AI-related risks and emphasize the importance of corporate responsibility in developing safer and more ethical AI systems.

item.title: CO-Bench: Benchmarking Language Model Agents in Algorithm Search for Combinatorial Optimization
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: LLM-based agents, Combinatorial Optimization, CO-Bench, Benchmark suite, Real-world CO problems
总结: 本文介绍了LLM基代理在组合优化(CO)领域应用的研究相对较少的情况，强调了需要更深入理解其在解决结构化、约束性强的问题上的潜力。为了解决这个问题，作者提出了CO-Bench，一个包含来自多个领域和复杂程度的36个真实世界CO问题的基准测试套件，旨在支持对LLM代理进行系统性研究。文章通过评估多种代理框架与传统人为设计的算法，揭示了当前方法的关键优势和局限性，并指出了未来研究的潜在方向。CO-Bench已在GitHub上公开可用。 <div> arXiv:2504.04310v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Although LLM-based agents have attracted significant attention in domains such as software engineering and machine learning research, their role in advancing combinatorial optimization (CO) remains relatively underexplored. This gap underscores the need for a deeper understanding of their potential in tackling structured, constraint-intensive problems-a pursuit currently limited by the absence of comprehensive benchmarks for systematic investigation. To address this, we introduce CO-Bench, a benchmark suite featuring 36 real-world CO problems drawn from a broad range of domains and complexity levels. CO-Bench includes structured problem formulations and curated data to support rigorous investigation of LLM agents. We evaluate multiple agent frameworks against established human-designed algorithms, revealing key strengths and limitations of current approaches and identifying promising directions for future research. CO-Bench is publicly available at https://github.com/sunnweiwei/CO-Bench.

item.title: Geo-OLM: Enabling Sustainable Earth Observation Studies with Cost-Efficient Open Language Models & State-Driven Workflows
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 地理空间协航员、地球观测、AI框架、开放语言模型、Geo-OLM
总结: 本文提出了Geo-OLM，一种利用状态驱动LLM推理范式的工具增强型地理空间代理。Geo-OLM通过减轻工作流推理负担，使低资源开放语言模型更有效地完成地理空间任务。相比于7B参数以下的最强前序地学基线，Geo-OLM在成功查询完成率上提高了32.8%。与需要花费\$500至\$1000的专有模型相比，Geo-OLM的结果性能接近GPT-4o，同时将推理成本降低了两个数量级至低于\$10。文章还进行了深入的地理空间下游基准分析，为实践者有效部署开放语言模型于地球观测应用提供了关键见解。 <div> arXiv:2504.04319v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Geospatial Copilots hold immense potential for automating Earth observation (EO) and climate monitoring workflows, yet their reliance on large-scale models such as GPT-4o introduces a paradox: tools intended for sustainability studies often incur unsustainable costs. Using agentic AI frameworks in geospatial applications can amass thousands of dollars in API charges or requires expensive, power-intensive GPUs for deployment, creating barriers for researchers, policymakers, and NGOs. Unfortunately, when geospatial Copilots are deployed with open language models (OLMs), performance often degrades due to their dependence on GPT-optimized logic. In this paper, we present Geo-OLM, a tool-augmented geospatial agent that leverages the novel paradigm of state-driven LLM reasoning to decouple task progression from tool calling. By alleviating the workflow reasoning burden, our approach enables low-resource OLMs to complete geospatial tasks more effectively. When downsizing to small models below 7B parameters, Geo-OLM outperforms the strongest prior geospatial baselines by 32.8% in successful query completion rates. Our method performs comparably to proprietary models achieving results within 10% of GPT-4o, while reducing inference costs by two orders of magnitude from \$500-\$1000 to under \$10. We present an in-depth analysis with geospatial downstream benchmarks, providing key insights to help practitioners effectively deploy OLMs for EO applications.

item.title: Economic Battery Storage Dispatch with Deep Reinforcement Learning from Rule-Based Demonstrations
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词：深度强化学习、电池调度、长期优化、软策略actor-critic（SAC）、学习从演示
总结: 近期，深度强化学习算法在经济电池调度问题上的应用显著增加，但针对长周期优化电池调度由于延迟奖励而面临挑战。研究者发现在以小时为单位的年周期训练中，流行的动作-评论家算法表现不佳。为解决这一问题，文章提出了一种扩展软策略actor-critic（SAC）的学习从演示方法。该方法的独特之处在于，在缺乏专家演示的情况下，通过简单的基于规则的策略生成演示数据。实验在与电网相连的微网案例研究中进行，利用基于电力批发价格的if-then-else语句来收集演示数据。这些演示数据被存储在单独的回放缓冲区中，并线性衰减概率地与智能体自身的经验一起采样。尽管这种改进方式简单且演示数据存在不完美，但结果显示其在样本效率和最终奖励方面都取得了显著的性能提升。进一步研究表明，提出的这种方法能够可靠地超越演示器并且对选择的规则具有鲁棒性，只要规则足以引导早期训练朝着正确的方向发展。 <div> arXiv:2504.04326v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The application of deep reinforcement learning algorithms to economic battery dispatch problems has significantly increased recently. However, optimizing battery dispatch over long horizons can be challenging due to delayed rewards. In our experiments we observe poor performance of popular actor-critic algorithms when trained on yearly episodes with hourly resolution. To address this, we propose an approach extending soft actor-critic (SAC) with learning from demonstrations. The special feature of our approach is that, due to the absence of expert demonstrations, the demonstration data is generated through simple, rule-based policies. We conduct a case study on a grid-connected microgrid and use if-then-else statements based on the wholesale price of electricity to collect demonstrations. These are stored in a separate replay buffer and sampled with linearly decaying probability along with the agent's own experiences. Despite these minimal modifications and the imperfections in the demonstration data, the results show a drastic performance improvement regarding both sample efficiency and final rewards. We further show that the proposed method reliably outperforms the demonstrator and is robust to the choice of rule, as long as the rule is sufficient to guide early training into the right direction.

item.title: ChronoSync: A Decentralized Chronometer Synchronization Protocol for Multi-Agent Systems
item.content:encoded:
关键词：多智能体系统、分布式时间同步算法、硬件钟、软件钟、漂移估计 总结: 该工作提出了一种针对多智能体系统的分布式时间同步算法。在环境现象（如温度、湿度、压力、g力等）影响下，每个智能体拥有两个时钟：一个受到干扰的硬件时钟和一个继承了硬件时钟扰动的可调节软件时钟。在此类扰动及各硬件时钟独立计时的条件下，该基于共识的控制器使得所有智能体能够将其软件定义的时钟调整到实际同步状态，并实现用户预设的共同时钟漂移。此外，将每个硬件时钟的漂移视为未知参数，该算法能准确估计其值。智能体间的耦合通过连通、无向、静态图进行建模。然而，每个智能体具有一套定时机制来决定何时广播其软件时间并更新自身的软件时间估计。因此，智能体之间的通信可以是定向的、间歇性的和异步的。整个系统的闭环动态由混合系统建模，利用李雅普诺夫稳定性分析方法证明，该集合所表示的时间同步与时钟漂移估计目标具有全局实际指数稳定性。理论发展的性能在仿真中得到了验证。

arXiv:2504.04347v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This work presents a decentralized time synchronization algorithm for multi-agent systems. Each agent possesses two clocks, a hardware clock that is perturbed by environmental phenomena (e.g., temperature, humidity, pressure, g forces, etc.) and a steerable software clock that inherits the perturbations affecting the hardware clock. Under these disturbances and the independent time kept by the hardware clocks, our consensus-based controller enables all agents to steer their software-defined clocks into practical synchronization while achieving a common user-defined clock drift. Furthermore, we treat the drift of each hardware clock as an unknown parameter, which our algorithm can accurately estimate. The coupling of the agents is modeled by a connected, undirected, and static graph. However, each agent possesses a timer mechanism that determines when to broadcast a sample of its software time and update its own software-time estimate. Hence, communication between agents can be directed, intermittent, and asynchronous. The closed-loop dynamics of the ensemble is modeled using a hybrid system, where a Lyapunov-based stability analysis demonstrates that a set encoding the time synchronization and clock drift estimation objectives is globally practically exponentially stable. The performance suggested by the theoretical development is confirmed in simulation.

item.title: OmniDrive: A Holistic Vision-Language Dataset for Autonomous Driving with Counterfactual Reasoning
item.content:encoded:
关键词: vision-language 模型、3D 理解、OmniDrive、合成数据标注、自动驾驶决策

总结: 本文提出了一个名为 OmniDrive 的全新视觉-语言数据集，旨在将先进视觉-语言模型的能力从二维扩展到三维驾驶任务的理解。通过反事实推理方法，该数据集使代理模型与3D驾驶任务对齐，强化了决策过程中的潜在场景评估和结果预测。文中还介绍了基于 OmniDrive 的两种高级框架——Omni-L 和 Omni-Q，用于探究视觉-语言对齐与三维感知在构建高效大模型代理中的重要性。实验结果显示，OmniDrive 数据集和提出的框架在 DriveLM Q&A 基准测试及 nuScenes 开环规划任务上取得了显著提升，证实了其有效性。
arXiv:2504.04348v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The advances in vision-language models (VLMs) have led to a growing interest in autonomous driving to leverage their strong reasoning capabilities. However, extending these capabilities from 2D to full 3D understanding is crucial for real-world applications. To address this challenge, we propose OmniDrive, a holistic vision-language dataset that aligns agent models with 3D driving tasks through counterfactual reasoning. This approach enhances decision-making by evaluating potential scenarios and their outcomes, similar to human drivers considering alternative actions. Our counterfactual-based synthetic data annotation process generates large-scale, high-quality datasets, providing denser supervision signals that bridge planning trajectories and language-based reasoning. Futher, we explore two advanced OmniDrive-Agent frameworks, namely Omni-L and Omni-Q, to assess the importance of vision-language alignment versus 3D perception, revealing critical insights into designing effective LLM-agents. Significant improvements on the DriveLM Q\&A benchmark and nuScenes open-loop planning demonstrate the effectiveness of our dataset and methods.

item.title: AutoPDL: Automatic Prompt Optimization for LLM Agents
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 大型语言模型 (LLMs)，提示方式，AutoPDL，自动机器学习 (AutoML)，PDL编程语言 总结: 本文提出了一种名为AutoPDL的自动化方法，用于发现大型语言模型（LLMs）的良好配置。该方法将提示方式的选择视为结构化的AutoML问题，探索组合空间中的行为性和非行为性提示模式及示例。通过使用PDL提示编程语言实现常见提示模式的库，AutoPDL能够生成人类可读、可编辑和可执行的PDL程序，并支持源代码级别的优化，便于人工介入调整和重用。实验结果表明，AutoPDL在三个任务和六个不同参数规模（从8B到70B）的LLM上都取得了显著的准确性提升（平均提升9.5±17.5个百分点），最高提升达68.9pp，并揭示了所选提示策略会因模型和任务的不同而变化。

arXiv:2504.04365v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The performance of large language models (LLMs) depends on how they are prompted, with choices spanning both the high-level prompting pattern (e.g., Zero-Shot, CoT, ReAct, ReWOO) and the specific prompt content (instructions and few-shot demonstrations). Manually tuning this combination is tedious, error-prone, and non-transferable across LLMs or tasks. Therefore, this paper proposes AutoPDL, an automated approach to discover good LLM agent configurations. Our method frames this as a structured AutoML problem over a combinatorial space of agentic and non-agentic prompting patterns and demonstrations, using successive halving to efficiently navigate this space. We introduce a library implementing common prompting patterns using the PDL prompt programming language. AutoPDL solutions are human-readable, editable, and executable PDL programs that use this library. This approach also enables source-to-source optimization, allowing human-in-the-loop refinement and reuse. Evaluations across three tasks and six LLMs (ranging from 8B to 70B parameters) show consistent accuracy gains ($9.5\pm17.5$ percentage points), up to 68.9pp, and reveal that selected prompting strategies vary across models and tasks.

item.title: Solving Sokoban using Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning with Landmarks
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词： Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning (HRL)，Recursive Planning，Learned Subgoals，Sokoban，Deep Recursive Goal Decomposition
总结: 本文介绍了一种新颖的层次强化学习（HRL）框架，该框架通过学习到的子目标进行自顶向下的递归规划，并成功应用于复杂的组合解谜游戏Sokoban。这种方法构建了六层策略层级，每一层高层策略为下一层生成子目标。所有的子目标和策略都是从零开始，端到端地学习得到，无需任何领域知识。实验结果显示，代理能够根据单次高层调用生成长序列动作。尽管先前的研究已经探索了2-3级的层级结构和基于子目标的规划启发式方法，但本文证明了深度递归目标分解完全可以通过学习自行产生，并且此类层级结构可以有效地扩展到困难的解谜域。 <div> arXiv:2504.04366v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce a novel hierarchical reinforcement learning (HRL) framework that performs top-down recursive planning via learned subgoals, successfully applied to the complex combinatorial puzzle game Sokoban. Our approach constructs a six-level policy hierarchy, where each higher-level policy generates subgoals for the level below. All subgoals and policies are learned end-to-end from scratch, without any domain knowledge. Our results show that the agent can generate long action sequences from a single high-level call. While prior work has explored 2-3 level hierarchies and subgoal-based planning heuristics, we demonstrate that deep recursive goal decomposition can emerge purely from learning, and that such hierarchies can scale effectively to hard puzzle domains.

item.title: Human-Level Competitive Pok\'emon via Scalable Offline Reinforcement Learning with Transformers
item.content:encoded:
关键词: Competitive Pok\'emon Singles, AI, offline policy training, large sequence models, human battle dataset
总结: 本文介绍了针对流行策略游戏“竞技宝可梦单打”（Competitive Pok\'emon Singles, CPS）的研究。研究团队开发了一种从第三方视角转为第一人称视角的重建方法，从而解锁了一个包含超过十年的真实人类对战数据集，并且该数据集每天都在持续扩大。利用这个数据集，研究人员采用黑盒方式训练大规模序列模型，使AI仅依据输入轨迹就能适应对手并选择招式，无需进行显式的搜索操作。研究逐步探索了从模仿学习到离线强化学习再到基于自我对战数据的离线微调的过程。实验结果显示，所提出的AI代理在四个最古老、部分可观测的宝可梦游戏中超越了近期的LLM Agent方法和一个强大的启发式搜索引擎，并在匿名在线对战中打入了前10%活跃玩家的排名。
arXiv:2504.04395v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Competitive Pok\'emon Singles (CPS) is a popular strategy game where players learn to exploit their opponent based on imperfect information in battles that can last more than one hundred stochastic turns. AI research in CPS has been led by heuristic tree search and online self-play, but the game may also create a platform to study adaptive policies trained offline on large datasets. We develop a pipeline to reconstruct the first-person perspective of an agent from logs saved from the third-person perspective of a spectator, thereby unlocking a dataset of real human battles spanning more than a decade that grows larger every day. This dataset enables a black-box approach where we train large sequence models to adapt to their opponent based solely on their input trajectory while selecting moves without explicit search of any kind. We study a progression from imitation learning to offline RL and offline fine-tuning on self-play data in the hardcore competitive setting of Pok\'emon's four oldest (and most partially observed) game generations. The resulting agents outperform a recent LLM Agent approach and a strong heuristic search engine. While playing anonymously in online battles against humans, our best agents climb to rankings inside the top 10% of active players.

item.title: DRAMA: A Dynamic Packet Routing Algorithm using Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Emergent Communication
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 强化学习(RL), 多智能体强化学习(MARL), 动态路由算法(DRAMA), 演化通信, 网络拓扑动态适应
总结: 随着网络数据的持续扩展，传统路由算法面临严峻挑战。本文提出了一个新颖的动态路由算法DRAMA，它利用多智能体强化学习中的演化通信来解决这一问题。DRAMA使得路由器能学会如何有效地进行通信以最大化优化目标，同时引入了一种新的Q网络和基于图的演化通信机制，能够在不需重新训练的情况下动态适应网络拓扑变化，确保了性能的稳健性。实验结果表明，相比于传统的路由算法和其他RL/MARL基算法，DRAMA在包括动态网络负载和拓扑在内的多种网络场景下，具有更高的投递率和更低的延迟。此外，通过对比实验验证了演化通信在促进数据包路由方面的潜力。 <div> arXiv:2504.04438v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The continuous expansion of network data presents a pressing challenge for conventional routing algorithms. As the demand escalates, these algorithms are struggling to cope. In this context, reinforcement learning (RL) and multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) algorithms emerge as promising solutions. However, the urgency and importance of the problem are clear, as existing RL/MARL-based routing approaches lack effective communication in run time among routers, making it challenging for individual routers to adapt to complex and dynamic changing networks. More importantly, they lack the ability to deal with dynamically changing network topology, especially the addition of the router, due to the non-scalability of their neural networks. This paper proposes a novel dynamic routing algorithm, DRAMA, incorporating emergent communication in multi-agent reinforcement learning. Through emergent communication, routers could learn how to communicate effectively to maximize the optimization objectives. Meanwhile, a new Q-network and graph-based emergent communication are introduced to dynamically adapt to the changing network topology without retraining while ensuring robust performance. Experimental results showcase DRAMA's superior performance over the traditional routing algorithm and other RL/MARL-based algorithms, achieving a higher delivery rate and lower latency in diverse network scenarios, including dynamic network load and topology. Moreover, an ablation experiment validates the prospect of emergent communication in facilitating packet routing.

item.title: VideoAgent2: Enhancing the LLM-Based Agent System for Long-Form Video Understanding by Uncertainty-Aware CoT
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 长视频理解、智能体方法、大型语言模型、chain-of-thought (CoT) 过程、不确定性估计
总结: 本文针对长视频理解任务中的挑战，提出了一个专门适用于长视频分析的chain-of-thought (CoT) 过程，旨在增强大型语言模型在处理此类任务中的推理能力。该过程结合了计划调整模式，使模型能逐步规划并适应其信息收集策略。同时，通过引入对外部工具和LLM自身的不确定性估计，引导CoT进程，使模型能评估新信息的可靠性，并做出更稳健的决策。为此，作者开发了一个名为VideoAgent2的系统，其中包括一般上下文获取和专用工具设计等模块。实验表明，VideoAgent2有效地缓解了来自外部工具的噪声影响，提高了输出的可靠性。在三个长视频基准数据集（及其子集）上的评估结果显示，VideoAgent2相比先前基于智能体的方法VideoAgent平均提升了13.1%，并在所有零样本方法中表现出领先的性能。
arXiv:2504.04471v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Long video understanding has emerged as an increasingly important yet challenging task in computer vision. Agent-based approaches are gaining popularity for processing long videos, as they can handle extended sequences and integrate various tools to capture fine-grained information. However, existing methods still face several challenges: (1) they often rely solely on the reasoning ability of large language models (LLMs) without dedicated mechanisms to enhance reasoning in long video scenarios; and (2) they remain vulnerable to errors or noise from external tools. To address these issues, we propose a specialized chain-of-thought (CoT) process tailored for long video analysis. Our proposed CoT with plan-adjust mode enables the LLM to incrementally plan and adapt its information-gathering strategy. We further incorporate heuristic uncertainty estimation of both the LLM and external tools to guide the CoT process. This allows the LLM to assess the reliability of newly collected information, refine its collection strategy, and make more robust decisions when synthesizing final answers. Empirical experiments show that our uncertainty-aware CoT effectively mitigates noise from external tools, leading to more reliable outputs. We implement our approach in a system called VideoAgent2, which also includes additional modules such as general context acquisition and specialized tool design. Evaluation on three dedicated long video benchmarks (and their subsets) demonstrates that VideoAgent2 outperforms the previous state-of-the-art agent-based method, VideoAgent, by an average of 13.1% and achieves leading performance among all zero-shot approaches

item.title: Distributed Nash Equilibrium Seeking in Coalition Games for Uncertain Euler-Lagrange Systems With Application to USV Swarm Confrontation
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词：联盟游戏，局部约束，耦合约束，不确定Euler-Lagrange系统，Nash均衡
总结:
本文研究了一种具有局部和耦合约束的联盟游戏，应用于受到未知边界扰动的不确定Euler-Lagrange系统中。游戏中，每个智能体与同联盟内的其他智能体合作优化其联盟的成本函数，同时对抗来自其他联盟的智能体。文中提出了一种分布式策略，在仅能访问自身动作、成本函数及约束参数的分布式框架下寻找Nash均衡。通过结合自适应方法和符号函数，该策略能够补偿并抑制系统的模型不确定性以及扰动。进一步地，将自适应方法和共识协议结合起来更新局部和耦合约束的Lagrange乘子。采用动态平均一致性算法估计联盟函数的梯度，而领导者跟随协议用于估计其他智能体的动作。利用Lyapunov理论证明了Nash均衡的渐近稳定性。此外，文章以联盟游戏框架为背景，详细建模并分析了一个无人水面艇群的对抗任务，包括阵型形成、包围和拦截等多种任务场景。数值例子验证了所提算法的有效性。 <div> arXiv:2504.04475v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, a coalition game with local and coupling constraints is studied for uncertain Euler-Lagrange (EL) systems subject to disturbances with unknown bounds. In the coalition game, each agent collaborates with other agents within the same coalition to optimize its coalition's cost function while simultaneously competing against agents in other coalitions. Under a distributed framework where each agent has access only to its own action, cost function, and constraint parameters, a distributed strategy is proposed to seek the Nash equilibrium (NE). By combining adaptive methods and sign functions, model uncertainties and disturbances with unknown bounds in the EL system are compensated and suppressed, respectively. Furthermore, an integration of adaptive methods and consensus protocols is employed to update the Lagrange multipliers of both local and coupling constraints. A dynamic average consensus is employed to estimate the gradient of coalition function, while the leader-following protocol is adopted to estimate the actions of other agents. By leveraging Lyapunov theory, the NE is proven to be asymptotically stable. Moreover, an unmanned surface vehicle swarm confrontation is meticulously modeled and analyzed in the coalition game framework. A diverse array of tasks, including formation, encirclement, and interception, are systematically formulated. A numerical example demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm.

item.title: Building LLM Agents by Incorporating Insights from Computer Systems
item.content:encoded:
关键词：LLM驱动的自主代理、系统设计原则、冯·诺依曼架构、模块化设计、学习机制

总结: 本文提出了一种将大型语言模型（LLM）驱动的自主代理系统设计与计算机系统原理相结合的新框架。研究指出当前LLM代理的设计多依赖于经验和直觉，缺乏系统性和扩展性。作者倡导借鉴冯·诺依曼架构的思想，强调LLM代理系统的模块化设计和普适性原则。文章首先从计算机系统视角全面回顾了LLM代理，接着指出了受计算机系统设计启发的关键挑战和未来发展方向，并探讨了LLM代理超越计算机系统的学习机制。通过这种比较分析，作者为LLM代理的系统化设计及其未来发展奠定了基础。
arXiv:2504.04485v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: LLM-driven autonomous agents have emerged as a promising direction in recent years. However, many of these LLM agents are designed empirically or based on intuition, often lacking systematic design principles, which results in diverse agent structures with limited generality and scalability. In this paper, we advocate for building LLM agents by incorporating insights from computer systems. Inspired by the von Neumann architecture, we propose a structured framework for LLM agentic systems, emphasizing modular design and universal principles. Specifically, this paper first provides a comprehensive review of LLM agents from the computer system perspective, then identifies key challenges and future directions inspired by computer system design, and finally explores the learning mechanisms for LLM agents beyond the computer system. The insights gained from this comparative analysis offer a foundation for systematic LLM agent design and advancement.

item.title: Public speech recognition transcripts as a configuring parameter
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 语音识别转录、智能手机、社交机器人、人类交互、语境特征
总结: 该文探讨了自动语音识别转录功能在人机互动中的影响。研究基于与类人机器人的面对面互动实证数据，指出显示人类说话内容的转录文本是一种重要的语境特征，它会显著影响人类参与者对机器人的行为理解和反应，即人类可能会根据转录文本将机器人的回应视为特定类型的动作并认为其是对自身先前发言的合适回应。这一现象在智能手机语音助手和少数具有类似功能的社交机器人中存在。 <div> arXiv:2504.04488v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Displaying a written transcript of what a human said (i.e. producing an "automatic speech recognition transcript") is a common feature for smartphone vocal assistants: the utterance produced by a human speaker (e.g. a question) is displayed on the screen while it is being verbally responded to by the vocal assistant. Although very rarely, this feature also exists on some "social" robots which transcribe human interactants' speech on a screen or a tablet. We argue that this informational configuration is pragmatically consequential on the interaction, both for human participants and for the embodied conversational agent. Based on a corpus of co-present interactions with a humanoid robot, we attempt to show that this transcript is a contextual feature which can heavily impact the actions ascribed by humans to the robot: that is, the way in which humans respond to the robot's behavior as constituting a specific type of action (rather than another) and as constituting an adequate response to their own previous turn.

item.title: SchEdge: A Dynamic, Multi-agent, and Scalable Scheduling Simulator for IoT Edge
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: SchEdge、IoT、任务调度、在线、模拟器
总结: 本文介绍了一个名为“SchEdge”的动态、自适应和可扩展的物联网边缘任务调度模拟框架。该模拟器设计为高度可配置，能够真实反映现实世界中物联网的详细特征。SchEdge侧重于在线任务调度，并利用其多代理性质支持多种调度策略并行实施。它主要由两部分组成：工作流和数据流，其中工作流管理调度器与应用程序和环境的交互，而数据流则处理输入应用及其预处理。这些组成部分相结合使得SchEdge具备了可伸缩性、自适应性和效率。为了验证该模拟器的有效性，文章进行了几项行为和技术分析实验，证明了它的效率、可伸缩性和鲁棒性。 <div> arXiv:2504.04555v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper presents a dynamic, adaptive, and scalable framework for simulating task scheduling on the edge of the Internet of Things called "SchEdge". This simulator is designed to be highly configurable to reflect the detailed characteristics of real-world IoT. This framework focuses on online task scheduling and its multi-agent nature provides multiple schedulers to implement various scheduling schemes in parallel. SchEdge consists of two main parts the workflow and data flow. The workflow manages the schedulers' interaction with the application and environment while the data flow deals with the input application and its preprocessing. Combining these sections provides scalability, adaptability, and efficiency in the SchEdge. To validate the efficiency of this simulator, several experiments categorized as behavioral and technical analysis are performed to show its efficiency, scalability, and robustness.

item.title: "You just can't go around killing people" Explaining Agent Behavior to a Human Terminator
item.content:encoded:
关键词：pre-trained agent, environment, human operator, intervention, explainability scheme

总结: 本文探讨了预训练智能体在环境中运行时，人类操作员可以决定暂时终止其运行并接手控制一段时间的场景。这种情况常见于人机交互领域，如自动驾驶、工厂自动化和医疗保健。文章指出了在这种设置下，存在一个权衡：如果不允许接管，则智能体可能采用次优或危险的策略；如果接管次数过多，则会降低人类对智能体的信任，限制其实用性。为了解决这一问题，论文提出了一个解释性方案，旨在帮助优化人类干预的次数，从而实现更好的人机协作效果。
arXiv:2504.04592v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Consider a setting where a pre-trained agent is operating in an environment and a human operator can decide to temporarily terminate its operation and take-over for some duration of time. These kind of scenarios are common in human-machine interactions, for example in autonomous driving, factory automation and healthcare. In these settings, we typically observe a trade-off between two extreme cases -- if no take-overs are allowed, then the agent might employ a sub-optimal, possibly dangerous policy. Alternatively, if there are too many take-overs, then the human has no confidence in the agent, greatly limiting its usefulness. In this paper, we formalize this setup and propose an explainability scheme to help optimize the number of human interventions.

item.title: AI in a vat: Fundamental limits of efficient world modelling for agent sandboxing and interpretability
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: world models, AI agents, computational demands, efficiency, interpretability
总结: 本文探讨了使用世界模型生成可控虚拟环境以测试AI代理安全性和可靠性的方法。针对高计算需求限制评估范围和深度的问题，研究从“缸中之脑”思想实验获取灵感，提出了一种简化世界模型的方法，该方法遵循计算力学原理，揭示了构建世界模型时效率与可解释性之间的基本权衡。基于此权衡，文章指出了构建能最小化内存要求、界定可学习边界以及跟踪不良结果原因的世界模型的策略。由此，本文确立了世界建模的基本局限性，为有效设计AI代理评估的核心选择提供了实操性指导原则。 <div> arXiv:2504.04608v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent work proposes using world models to generate controlled virtual environments in which AI agents can be tested before deployment to ensure their reliability and safety. However, accurate world models often have high computational demands that can severely restrict the scope and depth of such assessments. Inspired by the classic `brain in a vat' thought experiment, here we investigate ways of simplifying world models that remain agnostic to the AI agent under evaluation. By following principles from computational mechanics, our approach reveals a fundamental trade-off in world model construction between efficiency and interpretability, demonstrating that no single world model can optimise all desirable characteristics. Building on this trade-off, we identify procedures to build world models that either minimise memory requirements, delineate the boundaries of what is learnable, or allow tracking causes of undesirable outcomes. In doing so, this work establishes fundamental limits in world modelling, leading to actionable guidelines that inform core design choices related to effective agent evaluation.

item.title: Conformal Data-driven Control of Stochastic Multi-Agent Systems under Collaborative Signal Temporal Logic Specifications
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词：stochastic discrete-time linear multi-agent systems, collaborative signal temporal logic, conformal prediction, chance-constrained, distributed optimization
总结:
本文研究了带有附加随机噪声的离散时间线性多智能体系统（MAS）控制问题，这些系统需要满足具有预定概率的合作信号时序逻辑（STL）规范。文章利用符合预测（CP）方法，在分布无关的方式下解决相关的随机约束多智能体STL综合问题。通过引入非一致性分数和误差轨迹的预测区域（PR），提出了一种迭代的PR缩放和扰动反馈综合方法，用于训练误差轨迹样本的边界估计。然后利用另一份数据集对这些边界进行校准，通过CP提供概率保证。接着，论文通过基于任务鲁棒度函数的Lipschitz常数和计算得到的误差边界来紧致化随机优化控制问题。为了处理可扩展性问题，文章利用多智能体STL公式的组合结构，并提出了一个类模型预测控制算法，其中各个智能体的问题以分布式方式解决。最后，通过与文献[1]的对比示例展示了所提方法的优势。 <div> arXiv:2504.04615v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the control of stochastic discrete-time linear multi-agent systems (MAS) subject to additive stochastic noise and collaborative signal temporal logic (STL) specifications to be satisfied with a desired probability. Given available disturbance datasets, we leverage conformal prediction (CP) to address the underlying chance-constrained multi-agent STL synthesis problem in a distribution-free manner. By introducing nonconformity scores as functions of prediction regions (PRs) of error trajectories, we develop an iterative PR-scaling and disturbance-feedback synthesis approach to bound training error trajectory samples. These bounds are then calibrated using a separate dataset, providing probabilistic guarantees via CP. Subsequently, we relax the underlying stochastic optimal control problem by tightening the robustness functions of collaborative tasks based on their Lipschitz constants and the computed error bounds. To address scalability, we exploit the compositional structure of the multi-agent STL formula and propose a model-predictive-control-like algorithm, where agent-level problems are solved in a distributed fashion. Lastly, we showcase the benefits of the proposed method in comparison with [1] via an illustrative example.

item.title: Distributed Mixed-Integer Quadratic Programming for Mixed-Traffic Intersection Control
item.content:encoded:
关键词：分布式算法、proximal ADMM、混合整数二次规划、交通灯系统、连接自动驾驶车辆

总结： 本文提出了一种利用proximal交替方向乘子法（ADMM）和序列约束收紧的分布式算法，用于解决与交通信号系统和连接自动化车辆（CAVs）在混合交通路口相关的混合整数二次规划（MIQP）问题。该研究构建了一个全面的MIQP模型，旨在优化交通信号系统的协调以及高渗透率条件下的CAV集成优势。通过将复杂的多代理MIQP问题近似化，他们开发了一种分布式算法，使用proximal ADMM求解MIQP的凸松弛问题，并逐步收紧约束系数以保持整数要求。通过一系列针对不同渗透率和交通量的模拟验证了控制框架的性能及其分布式算法的有效性。
arXiv:2504.04618v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we present a distributed algorithm utilizing the proximal alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM) in conjunction with sequential constraint tightening to address mixed-integer quadratic programming (MIQP) problems associated with traffic light systems and connected automated vehicles (CAVs) in mixed-traffic intersections. We formulate a comprehensive MIQP model aimed at optimizing the coordination of traffic light systems and CAVs, thereby fully capitalizing on the advantages of CAV integration under conditions of high penetration rates. To effectively approximate the intricate multi-agent MIQP challenges, we develop a distributed algorithm that employs proximal ADMM for solving the convex relaxation of the MIQP while systematically tightening the constraint coefficients to uphold integrality requirements. The performance of our control framework and the efficacy of the distributed algorithm are rigorously validated through a series of simulations conducted across varying penetration rates and traffic volumes.

item.title: Autono: ReAct-Based Highly Robust Autonomous Agent Framework
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 自主代理框架、ReAct范式、适应性决策、多agent协作、及时放弃策略
总结: 本文提出了一种基于ReAct范式的高度鲁棒自主代理框架，该框架旨在通过适应性决策和多agent协作解决复杂任务。与依赖于由LLM基规划器生成的固定工作流的传统框架不同，该框架能在执行过程中根据先前轨迹动态生成下一步行动，从而增强其鲁棒性。为了解决因自适应执行路径可能导致的任务终止问题，文章提出了一个结合概率惩罚机制的适时放弃策略。对于多agent协作，文中引入了记忆转移机制，允许各agent之间的共享和动态更新内存。创新性的适时放弃策略通过概率惩罚动态调整任务放弃的可能性，使开发者可以通过调整超参数来平衡代理执行策略中的保守性和探索性倾向，显著提高了复杂环境下的适应性和任务执行效率。此外，通过模块化设计和MCP协议兼容性，代理人能够支持外部工具集成以扩展动作空间。通过明确分工，多agent协作机制使得各代理能专注于特定任务组件，从而显著提高执行效率和质量。 <div> arXiv:2504.04650v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper proposes a highly robust autonomous agent framework based on the ReAct paradigm, designed to solve complex tasks through adaptive decision making and multi-agent collaboration. Unlike traditional frameworks that rely on fixed workflows generated by LLM-based planners, this framework dynamically generates next actions during agent execution based on prior trajectories, thereby enhancing its robustness. To address potential termination issues caused by adaptive execution paths, I propose a timely abandonment strategy incorporating a probabilistic penalty mechanism. For multi-agent collaboration, I introduce a memory transfer mechanism that enables shared and dynamically updated memory among agents. The framework's innovative timely abandonment strategy dynamically adjusts the probability of task abandonment via probabilistic penalties, allowing developers to balance conservative and exploratory tendencies in agent execution strategies by tuning hyperparameters. This significantly improves adaptability and task execution efficiency in complex environments. Additionally, agents can be extended through external tool integration, supported by modular design and MCP protocol compatibility, which enables flexible action space expansion. Through explicit division of labor, the multi-agent collaboration mechanism enables agents to focus on specific task components, thereby significantly improving execution efficiency and quality.

item.title: HypRL: Reinforcement Learning of Control Policies for Hyperproperties
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 学习控制策略、复杂任务、超属性、HyperLTL公式、强化学习

总结: 本文研究了使用超属性来指定复杂任务要求的学习控制策略问题。超属性由于其对多智能体系统及多重执行轨迹表达能力的要求而被采用。针对带有未知转换的马尔科夫决策过程M和一个HyperLTL公式$\varphi$，文章首先利用Skolem化处理公式的量词交替。进一步地，文章引入了HyperLTL的定量鲁棒性函数来定义M中有限轨迹相对于$\varphi$的奖励。接着，通过一种适合的强化学习算法，学习(1)$\varphi$中的每个轨迹量化器对应的策略，以及(2)能够最大化预期奖励的M的转移概率分布，从而提高$\varphi$在M中的满足概率。文中展示了包括(1)安全保持的多智能体路径规划，(2)资源分配的公平性，以及(3)邮递员问题(PCR)等案例研究。
arXiv:2504.04675v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the problem of learning control policies for complex tasks whose requirements are given by a hyperproperty. The use of hyperproperties is motivated by their significant power to formally specify requirements of multi-agent systems as well as those that need expressiveness in terms of multiple execution traces (e.g., privacy and fairness). Given a Markov decision process M with unknown transitions (representing the environment) and a HyperLTL formula $\varphi$, our approach first employs Skolemization to handle quantifier alternations in $\varphi$. We introduce quantitative robustness functions for HyperLTL to define rewards of finite traces of M with respect to $\varphi$. Finally, we utilize a suitable reinforcement learning algorithm to learn (1) a policy per trace quantifier in $\varphi$, and (2) the probability distribution of transitions of M that together maximize the expected reward and, hence, probability of satisfaction of $\varphi$ in M. We present a set of case studies on (1) safety-preserving multi-agent path planning, (2) fairness in resource allocation, and (3) the post-correspondence problem (PCP).

item.title: Large-Scale Mixed-Traffic and Intersection Control using Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning
item.content:encoded:
关键词：交通拥堵、自动驾驶技术、强化学习、大规模混合交通控制、多智能体
总结: 本文针对现代城市网络中的交通拥堵问题，提出了一种使用去中心化多智能体强化学习方法对大规模混合交通进行控制的研究。此前的研究主要集中在小规模网络或单一交叉口，而本研究首次尝试将这种方法应用于现实世界中由信号灯和机器人车辆共同管理的大型交通网络，以科罗拉多斯普林斯市的一个包含14个交叉口的实际网络为例进行了评估。结果显示，在80%的自动驾驶汽车渗透率下，该方法将平均等待时间从6.17秒降低到5.09秒，同时将每500秒内的通过车辆数量从454辆提高到493辆，超过了完全采用信号灯控制的情况。这些发现表明，将基于强化学习的控制策略应用于大规模交通管理可以显著提高整体效率，并可能为未来的城市规划策略提供指导。
arXiv:2504.04691v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Traffic congestion remains a significant challenge in modern urban networks. Autonomous driving technologies have emerged as a potential solution. Among traffic control methods, reinforcement learning has shown superior performance over traffic signals in various scenarios. However, prior research has largely focused on small-scale networks or isolated intersections, leaving large-scale mixed traffic control largely unexplored. This study presents the first attempt to use decentralized multi-agent reinforcement learning for large-scale mixed traffic control in which some intersections are managed by traffic signals and others by robot vehicles. Evaluating a real-world network in Colorado Springs, CO, USA with 14 intersections, we measure traffic efficiency via average waiting time of vehicles at intersections and the number of vehicles reaching their destinations within a time window (i.e., throughput). At 80% RV penetration rate, our method reduces waiting time from 6.17 s to 5.09 s and increases throughput from 454 vehicles per 500 seconds to 493 vehicles per 500 seconds, outperforming the baseline of fully signalized intersections. These findings suggest that integrating reinforcement learning-based control large-scale traffic can improve overall efficiency and may inform future urban planning strategies.

item.title: Generalising from Self-Produced Data: Model Training Beyond Human Constraints
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 大型语言模型、自主生成、环境交互、无界奖励、GRPO算法

总结: 本文提出了一种新的AI框架，旨在让大型语言模型通过与环境的直接互动自主生成和验证新知识，突破人类训练数据和单一抽象层次的限制。该框架采用了一个无法被人为操纵的数值型奖励（如附加硬盘空间或关注者数量），以此引导学习而无需依赖人类设定的标准。AI代理会迭代生成策略和可执行代码以最大化这一指标，并基于成功的结果进行自我再训练和逐步泛化。为避免模型崩溃和warm start问题，框架强调实证验证优于文本相似性，并利用GRPO算法支持微调。系统架构采用了模块化的环境分析、策略生成和代码合成的智能体，实现可扩展的实验能力。这项工作勾勒出了通往具有自增强能力的人工智能系统并能够超越人类预设约束，迈向自主通用智能的道路。
arXiv:2504.04711v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current large language models (LLMs) are constrained by human-derived training data and limited by a single level of abstraction that impedes definitive truth judgments. This paper introduces a novel framework in which AI models autonomously generate and validate new knowledge through direct interaction with their environment. Central to this approach is an unbounded, ungamable numeric reward - such as annexed disk space or follower count - that guides learning without requiring human benchmarks. AI agents iteratively generate strategies and executable code to maximize this metric, with successful outcomes forming the basis for self-retraining and incremental generalisation. To mitigate model collapse and the warm start problem, the framework emphasizes empirical validation over textual similarity and supports fine-tuning via GRPO. The system architecture employs modular agents for environment analysis, strategy generation, and code synthesis, enabling scalable experimentation. This work outlines a pathway toward self-improving AI systems capable of advancing beyond human-imposed constraints toward autonomous general intelligence.

item.title: On the Robustness of GUI Grounding Models Against Image Attacks
item.content:encoded:
关键词：Graphical User Interface (GUI) grounding models、robustness、untargeted adversarial attacks、targeted adversarial attacks、UGround

总结: 本文着重探讨了图形用户界面(GUI)接地模型在现实场景中的鲁棒性问题，特别是针对自然噪声和对抗性干扰的抵抗力。研究团队对最先进的GUI接地模型，如UGround，进行了系统评估，涉及移动、桌面和网络等多种GUI环境。实验结果显示，这些模型对对抗性扰动及低分辨率条件表现出高度敏感性，揭示了GUI接地模型的脆弱性。这一发现为未来提升此类模型在实际应用中的鲁棒性研究提供了重要参考，并在文中提供了相关代码资源。
arXiv:2504.04716v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Graphical User Interface (GUI) grounding models are crucial for enabling intelligent agents to understand and interact with complex visual interfaces. However, these models face significant robustness challenges in real-world scenarios due to natural noise and adversarial perturbations, and their robustness remains underexplored. In this study, we systematically evaluate the robustness of state-of-the-art GUI grounding models, such as UGround, under three conditions: natural noise, untargeted adversarial attacks, and targeted adversarial attacks. Our experiments, which were conducted across a wide range of GUI environments, including mobile, desktop, and web interfaces, have clearly demonstrated that GUI grounding models exhibit a high degree of sensitivity to adversarial perturbations and low-resolution conditions. These findings provide valuable insights into the vulnerabilities of GUI grounding models and establish a strong benchmark for future research aimed at enhancing their robustness in practical applications. Our code is available at https://github.com/ZZZhr-1/Robust_GUI_Grounding.

item.title: Beyond Single-Turn: A Survey on Multi-Turn Interactions with Large Language Models
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 大型语言模型、多轮交互、任务特定场景、评价方法、增强策略
总结: 本文综述了大型语言模型（LLMs）在处理多轮交互方面的新进展。重点考察了从数学、编程等多元领域内的指令执行到复杂对话情境，如角色扮演、医疗、教育和对抗性越狱设置中的多轮交互挑战，涉及保持上下文、连贯性、公平性和响应性的难点。文章将当前的基准测试与数据集系统地归类为反映多轮对话评估演变趋势的不同类别。此外，文中回顾了一系列多轮设置下的增强方法，包括模型中心策略（上下文学习、监督微调、强化学习及新架构）、外部集成方法（记忆增强、检索式方法、知识图谱）以及用于协同交互的代理技术。最后，文章讨论了开放性挑战并提出了推动LLMs中多轮交互的鲁棒性和有效性的未来研究方向。相关资源和论文可在https://github.com/yubol-cmu/Awesome-Multi-Turn-LLMs获取。
arXiv:2504.04717v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have revolutionized their ability to handle single-turn tasks, yet real-world applications demand sophisticated multi-turn interactions. This survey provides a comprehensive review of recent advancements in evaluating and enhancing multi-turn interactions in LLMs. Focusing on task-specific scenarios, from instruction following in diverse domains such as math and coding to complex conversational engagements in roleplay, healthcare, education, and even adversarial jailbreak settings, we systematically examine the challenges of maintaining context, coherence, fairness, and responsiveness over prolonged dialogues. The paper organizes current benchmarks and datasets into coherent categories that reflect the evolving landscape of multi-turn dialogue evaluation. In addition, we review a range of enhancement methodologies under multi-turn settings, including model-centric strategies (contextual learning, supervised fine-tuning, reinforcement learning, and new architectures), external integration approaches (memory-augmented, retrieval-based methods, and knowledge graph), and agent-based techniques for collaborative interactions. Finally, we discuss open challenges and propose future directions for research to further advance the robustness and effectiveness of multi-turn interactions in LLMs. Related resources and papers are available at https://github.com/yubol-cmu/Awesome-Multi-Turn-LLMs.

item.title: Synthetic Data Generation & Multi-Step RL for Reasoning & Tool Use
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 强化学习, 多步优化, 合成数据生成, 步骤分解, SWiRL
总结:
本文提出了一个名为SWiRL（Step-Wise Reinforcement Learning）的新方法，该方法针对多步骤优化场景，旨在改进大型语言模型在复杂推理和代理任务中的性能。SWiRL通过迭代生成多步骤推理和工具使用数据，并基于这些数据进行强化学习。它采用了一个简单的步骤分解策略，将每个多步骤轨迹拆分为与原始模型每个动作对应的多个子轨迹，然后对这些子轨迹应用合成数据过滤和RL优化。实验结果显示，SWiRL在GSM8K、HotPotQA、CofCA、MuSiQue和BeerQA等多个多步骤工具使用、问题解答和数学推理任务上相对于基线方法分别提高了21.5%、12.3%、14.8%、11.1%和15.3%的相对准确性。此外，SWiRL还表现出跨任务泛化能力，例如仅在HotPotQA（文本问答）上训练即可使GSM8K（数学数据集）上的零样本性能提高16.9%。 <div> arXiv:2504.04736v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reinforcement learning has been shown to improve the performance of large language models. However, traditional approaches like RLHF or RLAIF treat the problem as single-step. As focus shifts toward more complex reasoning and agentic tasks, language models must take multiple steps of text generation, reasoning and environment interaction before generating a solution. We propose a synthetic data generation and RL methodology targeting multi-step optimization scenarios. This approach, called Step-Wise Reinforcement Learning (SWiRL), iteratively generates multi-step reasoning and tool use data, and then learns from that data. It employs a simple step-wise decomposition that breaks each multi-step trajectory into multiple sub-trajectories corresponding to each action by the original model. It then applies synthetic data filtering and RL optimization on these sub-trajectories. We evaluated SWiRL on a number of multi-step tool use, question answering, and mathematical reasoning tasks. Our experiments show that SWiRL outperforms baseline approaches by 21.5%, 12.3%, 14.8%, 11.1%, and 15.3% in relative accuracy on GSM8K, HotPotQA, CofCA, MuSiQue, and BeerQA, respectively. Excitingly, the approach exhibits generalization across tasks: for example, training only on HotPotQA (text question-answering) improves zero-shot performance on GSM8K (a math dataset) by a relative 16.9%.

item.title: Continuous Locomotive Crowd Behavior Generation
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 基于arXiv:2504.04756v1, 人群行为建模, 连续轨迹生成, 异质交互, 模拟框架

总结: 本文提出了一种新的方法，用于自动产生具有异质行为和个体间交互的连续、逼真的人群运动轨迹。该方法首先设计了人群发射器模型，通过输入图像获取空间布局信息，如分割图、外观图、人口密度图和人口概率等，随后使用扩散模型为不同时间点分配独立的行为特征，如代理人类型、步态和起止位置。接着，人群模拟器生成他们的长期移动行为，并可利用马尔科夫链增强其多样性动作。发射器与模拟器交替工作，使得场景中充满异质性的人群行为。此外，文章还提出了一种评估生成人群真实感和质量的基准协议，考虑了场景级人口动态和个体级轨迹精度。实验表明，该方法能有效模拟各种人群行为模式并具有良好泛化能力，适用于不同地理环境。代码已在https://github.com/InhwanBae/CrowdES 公开可用。
arXiv:2504.04756v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Modeling and reproducing crowd behaviors are important in various domains including psychology, robotics, transport engineering and virtual environments. Conventional methods have focused on synthesizing momentary scenes, which have difficulty in replicating the continuous nature of real-world crowds. In this paper, we introduce a novel method for automatically generating continuous, realistic crowd trajectories with heterogeneous behaviors and interactions among individuals. We first design a crowd emitter model. To do this, we obtain spatial layouts from single input images, including a segmentation map, appearance map, population density map and population probability, prior to crowd generation. The emitter then continually places individuals on the timeline by assigning independent behavior characteristics such as agents' type, pace, and start/end positions using diffusion models. Next, our crowd simulator produces their long-term locomotions. To simulate diverse actions, it can augment their behaviors based on a Markov chain. As a result, our overall framework populates the scenes with heterogeneous crowd behaviors by alternating between the proposed emitter and simulator. Note that all the components in the proposed framework are user-controllable. Lastly, we propose a benchmark protocol to evaluate the realism and quality of the generated crowds in terms of the scene-level population dynamics and the individual-level trajectory accuracy. We demonstrate that our approach effectively models diverse crowd behavior patterns and generalizes well across different geographical environments. Code is publicly available at https://github.com/InhwanBae/CrowdES .

item.title: Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning for Multiple Anesthetics Collaborative Control
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 自动化控制、个性化、全静脉麻醉(TIVA)、多智能体深度强化学习(VD-MADRL)、靶控输注(TCI) 总结: 本文提出了一种新型框架——价值分解多智能体深度强化学习(VD-MADRL)，用于解决临床全静脉麻醉(TIVA)中个性化多麻醉药自动化控制的挑战。该框架优化了两种麻醉药（丙泊酚和瑞芬太尼）之间的协同控制，利用马尔科夫游戏(MG)确定各不相同的智能体间的最优行动。为了解决信用分配问题并加强协作控制，文章采用了多种价值函数分解方法。同时，通过基于随机森林(RF)的多变量环境模型模拟麻醉状态，并采用数据重采样与对齐技术确保同步轨迹数据。实验结果显示，VD-MADRL在普通外科和胸外科手术数据集上的表现优于人类经验，提高了给药精度并保持了麻醉状态的稳定性，具有显著的临床价值。

arXiv:2504.04765v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Automated control of personalized multiple anesthetics in clinical Total Intravenous Anesthesia (TIVA) is crucial yet challenging. Current systems, including target-controlled infusion (TCI) and closed-loop systems, either rely on relatively static pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) models or focus on single anesthetic control, limiting personalization and collaborative control. To address these issues, we propose a novel framework, Value Decomposition Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning (VD-MADRL). VD-MADRL optimizes the collaboration between two anesthetics propofol (Agent I) and remifentanil (Agent II). And It uses a Markov Game (MG) to identify optimal actions among heterogeneous agents. We employ various value function decomposition methods to resolve the credit allocation problem and enhance collaborative control. We also introduce a multivariate environment model based on random forest (RF) for anesthesia state simulation. Additionally, a data resampling and alignment technique ensures synchronized trajectory data. Our experiments on general and thoracic surgery datasets show that VD-MADRL performs better than human experience. It improves dose precision and keeps anesthesia states stable, providing great clinical value.

item.title: Playing Non-Embedded Card-Based Games with Reinforcement Learning
item.content:encoded:
关键词: AI游戏、非嵌入式强化学习、视觉输入、实时战略游戏、Clash Royale、对象检测数据集、图像获取、特征融合、决策制定、控制 总结:
本文提出了针对实时战略卡牌游戏Clash Royale的一种非嵌入式的离线强化学习训练策略。该策略使用视觉输入替代直接访问游戏状态信息，以实现与人类玩家公平的竞争条件。由于缺乏该游戏的对象检测数据集，研究者设计了一个高效的生成式对象检测数据集用于训练。通过运用最先进的物体检测和光学字符识别模型提取特征，该方法成功实现了移动设备上的实时图像获取、感知特征融合、决策制定及控制功能，并能击败内置AI对手。相关代码已开源在https://github.com/wty-yy/katacr。
arXiv:2504.04783v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Significant progress has been made in AI for games, including board games, MOBA, and RTS games. However, complex agents are typically developed in an embedded manner, directly accessing game state information, unlike human players who rely on noisy visual data, leading to unfair competition. Developing complex non-embedded agents remains challenging, especially in card-based RTS games with complex features and large state spaces. We propose a non-embedded offline reinforcement learning training strategy using visual inputs to achieve real-time autonomous gameplay in the RTS game Clash Royale. Due to the lack of a object detection dataset for this game, we designed an efficient generative object detection dataset for training. We extract features using state-of-the-art object detection and optical character recognition models. Our method enables real-time image acquisition, perception feature fusion, decision-making, and control on mobile devices, successfully defeating built-in AI opponents. All code is open-sourced at https://github.com/wty-yy/katacr.

item.title: Weak-for-Strong: Training Weak Meta-Agent to Harness Strong Executors
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 大型语言模型、训练免费方法、弱强结合框架、强化学习、工作流优化

总结: 本文提出了一种名为弱强结合Harnessing (W4S)的新颖框架，旨在有效利用当代大型语言模型（LLMs）的能力，特别是当直接微调既昂贵又不切实际的情况下。该框架通过训练成本更低的小型模型来定制和优化用于驱动强大模型的工作流程。W4S将工作流设计视为一个多回合马尔可夫决策过程，并引入强化学习进行无干预的代理工作流优化（RLAO）。通过与环境的迭代交互，元代理能够自动学习设计更高效的工作流程。实验结果显示，仅使用一小时GPU训练的7B规模的W4S元代理在十一个基准测试中对比最强基线性能提升了2.9%~24.6%，成功提升如GPT-3.5-Turbo和GPT-4o等最新模型的表现。尤为突出的是，W4S在面对已知和未知任务时展现出强大的泛化能力，为直接精细调整强大模型提供了一个高效且高性能的替代方案。
arXiv:2504.04785v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Efficiently leveraging of the capabilities of contemporary large language models (LLMs) is increasingly challenging, particularly when direct fine-tuning is expensive and often impractical. Existing training-free methods, including manually or automated designed workflows, typically demand substantial human effort or yield suboptimal results. This paper proposes Weak-for-Strong Harnessing (W4S), a novel framework that customizes smaller, cost-efficient language models to design and optimize workflows for harnessing stronger models. W4S formulates workflow design as a multi-turn markov decision process and introduces reinforcement learning for agentic workflow optimization (RLAO) to train a weak meta-agent. Through iterative interaction with the environment, the meta-agent learns to design increasingly effective workflows without manual intervention. Empirical results demonstrate the superiority of W4S that our 7B meta-agent, trained with just one GPU hour, outperforms the strongest baseline by 2.9% ~ 24.6% across eleven benchmarks, successfully elevating the performance of state-of-the-art models such as GPT-3.5-Turbo and GPT-4o. Notably, W4S exhibits strong generalization capabilities across both seen and unseen tasks, offering an efficient, high-performing alternative to directly fine-tuning strong models.

item.title: Multimodal Agricultural Agent Architecture (MA3): A New Paradigm for Intelligent Agricultural Decision-Making
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: 现代农业, 双重挑战, 多模态农业智能代理架构(MA3), 信息融合, 决策制定
总结: 本文针对现代农业面临的优化生产效率与实现可持续发展的双重挑战以及气候变化加剧导致农业生产系统不确定性风险增加的问题，提出了一种创新的多模态农业智能代理架构（MA3）。该架构利用跨模态信息融合和任务协作机制，实现了智能化的农业决策制定。研究中构建了一个涵盖分类、检测、视觉问答（VQA）、工具选择及代理评估等五大任务的多模态农业数据集。同时，文章设计了一个统一的糖料蔗疾病分类与检测工具的背部网络，并开发了糖料蔗疾病专家模型。通过引入创新的工具选择模块，成功构建了一种能有效执行分类、检测和VQA任务的多模态农业智能代理。此外，还提出了一个多维度定量评价框架并对其进行了全面评估，验证了MA3架构在农业场景下的实用性和鲁棒性。该研究为农业智能代理的发展提供了新的思路和方法，具有重要的理论与实践意义。研究成果将在论文被接受后公开源代码和数据集。 <div> arXiv:2504.04789v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As a strategic pillar industry for human survival and development, modern agriculture faces dual challenges: optimizing production efficiency and achieving sustainable development. Against the backdrop of intensified climate change leading to frequent extreme weather events, the uncertainty risks in agricultural production systems are increasing exponentially. To address these challenges, this study proposes an innovative \textbf{M}ultimodal \textbf{A}gricultural \textbf{A}gent \textbf{A}rchitecture (\textbf{MA3}), which leverages cross-modal information fusion and task collaboration mechanisms to achieve intelligent agricultural decision-making. This study constructs a multimodal agricultural agent dataset encompassing five major tasks: classification, detection, Visual Question Answering (VQA), tool selection, and agent evaluation. We propose a unified backbone for sugarcane disease classification and detection tools, as well as a sugarcane disease expert model. By integrating an innovative tool selection module, we develop a multimodal agricultural agent capable of effectively performing tasks in classification, detection, and VQA. Furthermore, we introduce a multi-dimensional quantitative evaluation framework and conduct a comprehensive assessment of the entire architecture over our evaluation dataset, thereby verifying the practicality and robustness of MA3 in agricultural scenarios. This study provides new insights and methodologies for the development of agricultural agents, holding significant theoretical and practical implications. Our source code and dataset will be made publicly available upon acceptance.

item.title: ELT-Bench: An End-to-End Benchmark for Evaluating AI Agents on ELT Pipelines
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: ELT、AI、数据工程、基准测试、ELT-Bench
总结: 随着云数据仓库的广泛应用，实践者越来越多地采用Extract-Load-Transform（ELT）管道。然而，设计这些管道往往需要大量手动工作以确保正确性。近年来，基于AI的方法在诸如文本到SQL等数据任务中展现出强大的能力，为减轻开发ELT管道的手动工作提供了机会。然而，现有的数据工程基准测试仅评估孤立的任务，如使用数据工具和编写数据转换查询，未能充分评价生成端到端ELT管道的AI代理性能。为此，文章提出了一种名为ELT-Bench的端到端基准测试，用于评估AI代理构建ELT管道的能力。ELT-Bench包含了涉及多种领域的100条管道、835张源表和203个数据模型。通过模拟涉及多样化数据源集成与流行数据工具使用的逼真场景，它能够评测AI代理处理复杂数据工程工作流的能力。研究者利用Spider-Agent和SWE-Agent两个代表性的代码代理框架及六个流行的大型语言模型（LLMs）对ELT-Bench进行了评估。结果显示，表现最好的Spider-Agent Claude-3.7-Sonnet带有扩展思考功能的代理，也只正确生成了3.9%的数据模型，平均每个管道的成本为$4.30，步骤数为89.3步。实验结果揭示了ELT-Bench带来的挑战，并强调需要更先进的AI代理来减少ELT工作流中的手动劳动。相关的代码和数据可在https://github.com/uiuc-kang-lab/ETL.git获取。 <div> arXiv:2504.04808v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Practitioners are increasingly turning to Extract-Load-Transform (ELT) pipelines with the widespread adoption of cloud data warehouses. However, designing these pipelines often involves significant manual work to ensure correctness. Recent advances in AI-based methods, which have shown strong capabilities in data tasks, such as text-to-SQL, present an opportunity to alleviate manual efforts in developing ELT pipelines. Unfortunately, current benchmarks in data engineering only evaluate isolated tasks, such as using data tools and writing data transformation queries, leaving a significant gap in evaluating AI agents for generating end-to-end ELT pipelines. To fill this gap, we introduce ELT-Bench, an end-to-end benchmark designed to assess the capabilities of AI agents to build ELT pipelines. ELT-Bench consists of 100 pipelines, including 835 source tables and 203 data models across various domains. By simulating realistic scenarios involving the integration of diverse data sources and the use of popular data tools, ELT-Bench evaluates AI agents' abilities in handling complex data engineering workflows. AI agents must interact with databases and data tools, write code and SQL queries, and orchestrate every pipeline stage. We evaluate two representative code agent frameworks, Spider-Agent and SWE-Agent, using six popular Large Language Models (LLMs) on ELT-Bench. The highest-performing agent, Spider-Agent Claude-3.7-Sonnet with extended thinking, correctly generates only 3.9% of data models, with an average cost of $4.30 and 89.3 steps per pipeline. Our experimental results demonstrate the challenges of ELT-Bench and highlight the need for a more advanced AI agent to reduce manual effort in ELT workflows. Our code and data are available at https://github.com/uiuc-kang-lab/ETL.git.

item.title: An Efficient Approach for Cooperative Multi-Agent Learning Problems
item.content:encoded:
关键词：多智能体学习、集中式框架、行动空间爆炸、序列抽象、监督者代理 总结: 本文提出了一种针对多智能体协作任务的集中式Multi-Agent Learning框架。该框架通过引入一个称为“监督者”的元代理来解决协调问题，它将多个智能体的联合动作抽象为对每个智能体的序列化动作分配，从而克服了集中式方法常见的行动空间爆炸问题，提高了框架的可扩展性和效率。实验结果显示，该方法成功地在多种规模和复杂度的多智能体学习环境中协调了智能体的行为。

arXiv:2504.04850v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article, we propose a centralized Multi-Agent Learning framework for learning a policy that models the simultaneous behavior of multiple agents that need to coordinate to solve a certain task. Centralized approaches often suffer from the explosion of an action space that is defined by all possible combinations of individual actions, known as joint actions. Our approach addresses the coordination problem via a sequential abstraction, which overcomes the scalability problems typical to centralized methods. It introduces a meta-agent, called \textit{supervisor}, which abstracts joint actions as sequential assignments of actions to each agent. This sequential abstraction not only simplifies the centralized joint action space but also enhances the framework's scalability and efficiency. Our experimental results demonstrate that the proposed approach successfully coordinates agents across a variety of Multi-Agent Learning environments of diverse sizes.

item.title: BIASINSPECTOR: Detecting Bias in Structured Data through LLM Agents
item.content:encoded:
关键词：BIASINSPECTOR、自动化偏见检测、结构化数据、大型语言模型、基准评价 总结: 本文介绍了首个端到端、多智能体协同框架BIASINSPECTOR，该框架专为基于用户特定需求的结构化数据自动偏见检测设计。它通过多阶段计划分析用户指定的偏见检测任务，并利用多样化和适应性强的工具集来实施。BIASINSPECTOR能够提供详细的检测结果，包括解释和可视化。鉴于缺乏评估大语言模型在数据偏见检测能力上的标准化框架，文章还提出了一项全面的基准测试，包括多种评估指标和大量的测试案例。通过广泛的实验，证明了BIASINSPECTOR在结构化数据偏见检测方面表现出卓越的整体性能，为此类更公平的数据应用设定了新的里程碑。

arXiv:2504.04855v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Detecting biases in structured data is a complex and time-consuming task. Existing automated techniques are limited in diversity of data types and heavily reliant on human case-by-case handling, resulting in a lack of generalizability. Currently, large language model (LLM)-based agents have made significant progress in data science, but their ability to detect data biases is still insufficiently explored. To address this gap, we introduce the first end-to-end, multi-agent synergy framework, BIASINSPECTOR, designed for automatic bias detection in structured data based on specific user requirements. It first develops a multi-stage plan to analyze user-specified bias detection tasks and then implements it with a diverse and well-suited set of tools. It delivers detailed results that include explanations and visualizations. To address the lack of a standardized framework for evaluating the capability of LLM agents to detect biases in data, we further propose a comprehensive benchmark that includes multiple evaluation metrics and a large set of test cases. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our framework achieves exceptional overall performance in structured data bias detection, setting a new milestone for fairer data applications.

item.title: GAMDTP: Dynamic Trajectory Prediction with Graph Attention Mamba Network
item.content:encoded:
<div> 关键词: GAMDTP、图注意力网络、动态轨迹预测、高精度地图、两阶段框架
总结: 本文介绍了GAMDTP，一种新型的基于图注意力的动态轨迹预测网络。GAMDTP通过门控机制融合自注意力和mamba-ssm的结果，以更有效地和准确地在每个图卷积层中提取特征。该模型能够同时编码高精度地图数据和交通参与者的历叐轨迹坐标，并将网络输出解码为最终预测结果。针对现有方法主要依赖于历史预测结果的动态融合及采用包括提案和细化的两阶段框架的问题，文中还设计了一种评分机制来评估在提案和细化过程中的预测质量。实验证实在Argoverse数据集上，GAMDTP达到了最先进的性能，在动态轨迹预测方面表现出优越的准确性。 <div> arXiv:2504.04862v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate motion prediction of traffic agents is crucial for the safety and stability of autonomous driving systems. In this paper, we introduce GAMDTP, a novel graph attention-based network tailored for dynamic trajectory prediction. Specifically, we fuse the result of self attention and mamba-ssm through a gate mechanism, leveraging the strengths of both to extract features more efficiently and accurately, in each graph convolution layer. GAMDTP encodes the high-definition map(HD map) data and the agents' historical trajectory coordinates and decodes the network's output to generate the final prediction results. Additionally, recent approaches predominantly focus on dynamically fusing historical forecast results and rely on two-stage frameworks including proposal and refinement. To further enhance the performance of the two-stage frameworks we also design a scoring mechanism to evaluate the prediction quality during the proposal and refinement processes. Experiments on the Argoverse dataset demonstrates that GAMDTP achieves state-of-the-art performance, achieving superior accuracy in dynamic trajectory prediction.

item.title: Simulating Persuasive Dialogues on Meat Reduction with Generative Agents
item.content:encoded:
关键词：肉食减少、社会规范、对话模拟、生成代理模型、理论预期
总结: 该文介绍了关于使用基于大型语言模型（LLMs）的生成代理模型来模拟多轮关于肉食减少的对话的工作进展。这些模拟旨在促进肉食减少的同时减轻社交成本。研究通过应用建立在计划行为理论基础上的心理学问卷测量主要结果，并探究社交成本问题。初步结果显示，模拟产生的结果与理论预期一致，并与过去涉及人类参与者的先前研究数据相比较具有有效性。生成代理模型被证明是一种有前景的工具，可用于为特定参与者群体识别出针对肉食减少的新型沟通策略，以便在后续的人类参与实验中进行测试。
arXiv:2504.04872v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Meat reduction benefits human and planetary health, but social norms keep meat central in shared meals. To date, the development of communication strategies that promote meat reduction while minimizing social costs has required the costly involvement of human participants at each stage of the process. We present work in progress on simulating multi-round dialogues on meat reduction between Generative Agents based on large language models (LLMs). We measure our main outcome using established psychological questionnaires based on the Theory of Planned Behavior and additionally investigate Social Costs. We find evidence that our preliminary simulations produce outcomes that are (i) consistent with theoretical expectations; and (ii) valid when compared to data from previous studies with human participants. Generative agent-based models are a promising tool for identifying novel communication strategies on meat reduction-tailored to highly specific participant groups-to then be tested in subsequent studies with human participants.

item.title: Hybrid Control Barrier Functions for Nonholonomic Multi-Agent Systems
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 多智能体协调、动态环境、控制 barrier 函数(CBF)、非holonomic 车辆、协同 CBFs (SCBF)

总结: 本文针对多智能体在动态环境中如何保障安全协调移动的问题进行了研究。已有的工作利用控制 Barrier 函数（CBF）有效地解决了该问题，但对于需要保持正速度的非holonomic车辆，现有的CBF方法不再适用。为解决这一局限性，文章提出了基于协同CBFs (SCBFs)的混合形式化方法，借助离散切换机制避免使CBF无效的配置。与现有方法不同的是，该方法能够在存在移动障碍物和智能体间交互的情况下，同时保证非零速度约束下的安全性。文中对约束条件的可行性相对于驱动限制进行了严格分析，并通过带有移动障碍物的多智能体协调问题的模拟验证了方案的有效性。
arXiv:2504.04937v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper addresses the problem of guaranteeing safety of multiple coordinated agents moving in dynamic environments. It has recently been shown that this problem can be efficiently solved through the notion of Control Barrier Functions (CBFs). However, for nonholonomic vehicles that are required to keep positive speeds, existing CBFs lose their validity. To overcome this limitation, we propose a hybrid formulation based on synergistic CBFs (SCBFs), which leverages a discrete switching mechanism to avoid configurations that would render the CBF invalid. Unlike existing approaches, our method ensures safety in the presence of moving obstacles and inter-agent interactions while respecting nonzero speed restrictions. We formally analyze the feasibility of the constraints with respect to actuation limits, and the efficacy of the solution is demonstrated in simulation of a multi-agent coordination problem in the presence of moving obstacles.

item.title: The Dream Within Huang Long Cave: AI-Driven Interactive Narrative for Family Storytelling and Emotional Reflection
item.content:encoded:
关键词: AI驱动、交互式叙事体验、心理分析、大他者、虚拟代理
总结: 本文介绍了艺术项目“黄龙洞之梦”，这是一个由AI驱动的互动沉浸式叙事体验。该项目将AI技术、艺术实践与心理分析相结合，对大他者概念不存在的现象提供了艺术性的回应。作品受到实际地理景观和家庭原型启发，通过结合大型语言模型（LLM）和逼真数字角色——虚拟代理人YELL，创造出一个对话与探索的洞穴自动虚拟环境（CAVE）。观众被邀请解决YELL提出的语言谜题并帮助他克服生活挑战。YELL作为大他者的虚构化身，模型基于艺术家真实的父亲，通过跨时代与这个数字父亲的互动，项目旨在解构复杂的家庭关系，通过展示大他者的非存在性强调人际关系中情感的真实性，并将艺术定位为建立家庭动态中情感连接和理解的桥梁。
arXiv:2504.04968v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper introduces the art project The Dream Within Huang Long Cave, an AI-driven interactive and immersive narrative experience. The project offers new insights into AI technology, artistic practice, and psychoanalysis. Inspired by actual geographical landscapes and familial archetypes, the work combines psychoanalytic theory and computational technology, providing an artistic response to the concept of the non-existence of the Big Other. The narrative is driven by a combination of a large language model (LLM) and a realistic digital character, forming a virtual agent named YELL. Through dialogue and exploration within a cave automatic virtual environment (CAVE), the audience is invited to unravel the language puzzles presented by YELL and help him overcome his life challenges. YELL is a fictional embodiment of the Big Other, modeled after the artist's real father. Through a cross-temporal interaction with this digital father, the project seeks to deconstruct complex familial relationships. By demonstrating the non-existence of the Big Other, we aim to underscore the authenticity of interpersonal emotions, positioning art as a bridge for emotional connection and understanding within family dynamics.

item.title: Joint Pedestrian and Vehicle Traffic Optimization in Urban Environments using Reinforcement Learning
item.content:encoded:
关键词: 强化学习(RL), 交通信号控制, 行人安全, 车辆效率, 真实世界数据 总结: 本文提出了一种深度强化学习框架，用于实际城市走廊中的八个交通信号灯的自适应控制，旨在同时优化行人和车辆的通行效率。与传统固定时间信号相比，该单智能体策略利用来自Wi-Fi日志和视频分析的真实世界行人和车辆需求数据进行训练，结果显示平均每位行人和每辆车的等待时间分别减少了最多67%和52%，同时也将两者的总累积等待时间降低了最多67%和53%。此外，研究结果还显示了该方法在面对训练期间未见过的各种交通需求变化条件下的泛化能力，进一步验证了强化学习在构建服务于所有道路使用者的交通运输系统的潜力。

arXiv:2504.05018v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reinforcement learning (RL) holds significant promise for adaptive traffic signal control. While existing RL-based methods demonstrate effectiveness in reducing vehicular congestion, their predominant focus on vehicle-centric optimization leaves pedestrian mobility needs and safety challenges unaddressed. In this paper, we present a deep RL framework for adaptive control of eight traffic signals along a real-world urban corridor, jointly optimizing both pedestrian and vehicular efficiency. Our single-agent policy is trained using real-world pedestrian and vehicle demand data derived from Wi-Fi logs and video analysis. The results demonstrate significant performance improvements over traditional fixed-time signals, reducing average wait times per pedestrian and per vehicle by up to 67% and 52%, respectively, while simultaneously decreasing total accumulated wait times for both groups by up to 67% and 53%. Additionally, our results demonstrate generalization capabilities across varying traffic demands, including conditions entirely unseen during training, validating RL's potential for developing transportation systems that serve all road users.

item.title: Mixture-of-Personas Language Models for Population Simulation
item.content:encoded:
关键词：大型语言模型、行为多样性、混合人格、概率性提示方法、目标人口

总结: 本文提出了一个新的概率性提示方法——“混合人格”(MoP)，用于增强大型语言模型(LLMs)在人类行为模拟等领域的应用。预训练的LLMs往往无法充分捕捉到目标人群的行为多样性。MoP是一种上下文混合模型，其中每个组件是一个具有特定人格和代表子群体行为的示例的语言模型代理。根据学习到的混合权重随机选择人格和示例，以在模拟过程中引导LLM产生多样化响应。MoP方法具有灵活性，不需要对模型进行微调，并且可以跨基础模型迁移。实验表明，与竞争方法相比，MoP在对齐性和多样性度量方面表现出色。
arXiv:2504.05019v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Advances in Large Language Models (LLMs) paved the way for their emerging applications in various domains, such as human behavior simulations, where LLMs could augment human-generated data in social science research and machine learning model training. However, pretrained LLMs often fail to capture the behavioral diversity of target populations due to the inherent variability across individuals and groups. To address this, we propose \textit{Mixture of Personas} (MoP), a \textit{probabilistic} prompting method that aligns the LLM responses with the target population. MoP is a contextual mixture model, where each component is an LM agent characterized by a persona and an exemplar representing subpopulation behaviors. The persona and exemplar are randomly chosen according to the learned mixing weights to elicit diverse LLM responses during simulation. MoP is flexible, requires no model finetuning, and is transferable across base models. Experiments for synthetic data generation show that MoP outperforms competing methods in alignment and diversity metrics.
